channel.title: Sinuses filled to the brim
channel.description:
I know this isn't the place to ask for medical advice, but I'll fire some questions nonetheless. As of yesterday, I'm experiencing the great symptoms of the common cold. Can't breath through my nose, ears are clogged up, headache, and exhaustion. All those symptoms will be over in about 10 days, except for one. My frontal sinuses are filled with mucus throughout the year. There is not a single day that I leave the house without a handkerchief. But it's also causing headaches more than once a month (almost once per two weeks, but there's no real pattern in it). There's no doubt the headaches originate in my sinuses, putting pressure on them makes it feel better.
So I decided to search for treatments of the symptoms (there's no cure for the common cold, so that's out of the question). The pain can be dealt with by taking painkillers. But my nose is still running, and the headache is primarily caused by my sinuses being filled. Also, blowing my nose every few minutes results in extra pain and a rash under my nose.
Nasal irrigation seems to do the trick. But for some reason squirting water up my nose doesn't seem fun. Is it something that will work? Are there any side-effects that outweigh the benefits? Should I just visit the doctor? The main reason I don't go to the doctor now is that he'll probably be pissed off when I tell him I have a runny nose, in the middle of the winter. He'll probably advise to wait 2 weeks and come back if it hasn't gotten any better.

item.title: Sinuses filled to the brim
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I have bad sinus problems too, the doctor prescribed ‘flonase’ or something like it, it’s a spray that goes up your nose with steroids of some type in it. I don’t really use it often enough to know if it helps or not. Generally, when I have symptoms I take some generic form of sudafed (the stuff with actual psuedoephedrine in it, not the other stuff), and it usually clears me up pretty well.

pseudoephedrine is the way to go, flonase doesnt even work for me, I take pseudophedrine daily

Read full topic

item.title: Sinuses filled to the brim
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

My best friends family has a really bad problem with all of their sinusses. I’ve never really seen my friend with a clear nose, and sometimes it can make him throw up and feel dizzy. His mum had it so bad, that she actually had to have some form of operation on her sinusses, and was in terrible pain for weeks. Either way, go to a doc, and as said above they’ll usually just throw you some anti-biotics and get on with it, but might be an idea to seek some specialist advice.

Read full topic

item.title: Sinuses filled to the brim
item.dc:creator: @mRED125 mRED125
item.description:
@mRED125 wrote:

Yeah, it does sound like an infection, i hope you feel better soon and you should do what the bank says and go too the doctor.

Read full topic

item.title: Sinuses filled to the brim
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

Go to the doctor bud, sounds like a sinus infection which will spread to your ears and eyes too, it gets ugly.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

My frontal sinuses are filled with mucus throughout the year.

There’s so much mucus and other stuff stuck up my nose that it stinks.

possible infection, go to the doctor.

item.title: Sinuses filled to the brim
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:11, topic:427232”][quote author=t4 link=topic=529931.msg3868742#msg3868742 date=1325188189]
gr8 for allergies
[/quote]

This might sound odd, but I’m starting to think it may be hay fever. It’s odd because it’s the middle of the winter now, but its a mild winter (it hasn’t really frozen yet), so the trees are actually starting to release pollen. And we’ve been coppicing this week.[/quote]
it’s possible to have allergies to things other than pollen

Read full topic

item.title: Sinuses filled to the brim
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

Could be Sinusitis? I get it sometimes when i get a cold Gives me some of the symptons you said. I got prescribed anti-biotics when i went to the doctors, But most of the time i just leave it and it goes away

Read full topic

I have bad sinus problems too, the doctor prescribed ‘flonase’ or something like it, it’s a spray that goes up your nose with steroids of some type in it.

Called Flixonase in Europe, and holy shit if it isn’t one of the worst smelling things I’ve ever smelled, haha
[/quote]

It’s certainly not pleasant smelling, especially after squirting it up your nose. :)[/quote]

That’s not a problem. There’s so much mucus and other stuff stuck up my nose that it stinks.

item.title: Sinuses filled to the brim
item.dc:creator: @Unicron Unicron
item.description:
@Unicron wrote:

Davidi2:

Have you tried steam inhalation? Usually there are special oils/teas you can put in the boiling water, then you use a towel over your head to trap the steam and inhale it.

for that matter try taking an extremely hot shower and after about 10 minutes you’ll be boiled but it has the same effect as what davidi just said. Also there is another remedy, get a peppermint extract (if you get the pill kind, cut it open and place it in a bowl). Then get a cotton swab and rub it in the oil, put it at the base of your nose under each nostril and it will sting to breath from your nose for a second but it will clear your sinuses.

Read full topic

item.title: Sinuses filled to the brim
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

I had a pretty wicked sinus/ear infection a few weeks ago, I wouldn’t wait too long to go see a doctor.
The doctor I saw wrote a script for amoxicillin along with Flonase, seemed to help a bit. Sudafed might be a good idea as well.

Nasal irrigation could also help out a lot, give it a try.

Read full topic

item.title: Sinuses filled to the brim
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

possible sinus infection? flush out your nasal passages with a stream of salt-water.

Read full topic
